sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使困惑，迷惑，糊涂，伤脑筋"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: puzzle, bewilder, confuse, embarrass, perplex, baffle, confound, distract
means: puzzle ： 侧重使人难于理解、困惑、伤脑筋。
bewilder ： 语气强烈，指因迷不解或惊愕而慌乱，不知所措，无法清醒地思考。
confuse ： 语气较弱，指由于混淆、混乱而糊涂。
embarrass ： 常指因处境或困难问题而感到窘迫、局促不安或焦急而不知所措。
perplex ： 除困惑外，还含焦虑或缺乏把握之意，因而难于作出决定，无从下手处理。
baffle ： 语气最强，多指遇见奇怪情景或复杂困难情况时所产生的惶恐困惑心理。
confound ： 常指人惊慌失措和狼狈不堪。
distract ： 主要用于注意力分散、思想矛盾或过分激动时产生的昏乱。

sentence.Network_en: I think it's a serious mistake to confuse books with life.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为把书本同生活混为一谈是大错特错。

sentence.Network_en: This is an attempt to confuse form and [ with ] substance.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是企图把形式同实质混 淆.

sentence.Network_en: People are apt to confuse the two issues.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们容易把这两个问题混淆起来.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... lucifugous a 避光的 confuse v 使混乱 confusion n 混乱.
大英语B级词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... conflict n./v. 斗争,冲突 confuse vt. 搞乱,使糊涂 confused adj. 困惑的.
大学四级高频词汇_百度知道 ... confront vt 迎面遇到；勇敢的面对；使对质 confuse vt 使困惑；混淆；混乱 conscience n 良心.
托福单词表 - 豆丁网 ... confront 面对，直接对抗 confuse 使迷惑 congenial 指人意气相投的.

list.abs: insignificant中文 ... Gwin 葛温 ... 颠三倒四 confused disorderly 调兵遣将 move forces.
高中英语短语总汇 - 豆丁网 ... in condition( 健康情况良好), in confusion( 在混乱中), ,in court( 出庭).
角色混乱 （ Role Confusion ）：指在第五发展阶段，个人没有获得某种同一性的出现的一种状态。
confusion 干扰，混乱confusion reflector 干扰反射器congenerous 协同的，共同的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'rout, bring to ruin'): from Old French confus, from Latin confusus, past participle of confundere 'mingle together' (see confound). Originally all senses of the verb were passive, and therefore appeared only as the past participle confused; the active voice occurred rarely until the 19th cent. when it began to replace confound

entry.def: If you confuse two things, you get them mixed up, so that you think one of them is the other one.

example.ex: Great care is taken to avoid confusing the two types of projects...
example.tran: 大家非常谨慎，以免把这两类项目弄混。

example.ex: I can't see how anyone could confuse you with another!
example.tran: 我不明白怎么会有人把你和另外一个人搞混！

entry.def: To confuse someone means to make it difficult for them to know exactly what is happening or what to do.

example.ex: German politics surprised and confused  him.
example.tran: 德国政治既令他惊讶，又让他困惑不解。

entry.def: To confuse a situation means to make it complicated or difficult to understand.

example.ex: To further confuse the issue, there is an enormous variation in the amount of sleep people feel happy with.
example.tran: 使问题进一步复杂化的是，每个人需要的睡眠时间千差万别。

sentences.sentence: "you are confusing me with the other candidate"

means.word_mean: 2. be confusing or perplexing to; cause to be unable to think clearly;

sentences.sentence: "The constant attention of the young man confused her"
"She jumbles the words when she is supposed to write a sentence"
"The new tax return forms only confuse"

auth_sentence.content: Which means, don't confuse cause and effect.
auth_sentence.res_content: Which means, don't confuse cause and effect.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Which means, don't confuse cause and effect.

auth_sentence.content: It is important to not confuse religion with spirituality.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is important to not confuse religion with spirituality.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is important to not confuse religion with spirituality.

auth_sentence.content: The TNC seems to confuse black people with mercenaries.
auth_sentence.res_content: The TNC seems to confuse black people with mercenaries.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The TNC seems to confuse black people with mercenaries.

Sentence.sentence: It seemed very confusing for a long time
When you try to figure out a confusing game
This crazy bus schedule has got me completely confused.
Educators may fear that children hearing two languages will become permanently confused and thus their language development will be delayed ;this concern is not documented in the literature.
He found that many of his subjects were confused by the infinite options their money presented them with
They can become confused by seeing many photographs or similar faces.

sentences.en: They asked so many questions that they confused me.
sentences.cn: 他们问了许多问题, 都把我弄糊涂了。

sentences.en: Many people are confused about the new ways of measuring temperature.
sentences.cn: 许多人都搞不清测定温度的新方法。

sentences.en: This is an attempt to confuse form and[with] substance.
sentences.cn: 这是企图把形式同实质混淆。

jushi.english: You have confused the meanings of the two words.
jushi.chinese: 你混淆了这两个词的意思。

jushi.english: He has confused everything in the room.
jushi.chinese: 他把室内的东西全都弄乱了。

jushi.english: He was confused by the noise.
